attributes.action: ensure that MPs are not exempted from the requirements of  the FOI Act with regard to their remuneration and any expense claim.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: There seems to be a move from the Conservative Party's former Chief Whip David McLean to introduce a Bill for MPs to exempt themselves from FOI Laws.  This is dressed up as necessary to protect constituents' correspondence.  Such a move is not in the public interest and is more indicative of MPs, rather, not wanting the taxpayer to know about their personal and travelling expense claims which are funded from the public purse.

rejection.details: This petition overlaps with several already in existence - http://petitions.pm.gov.uk/FewerMPs/
reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
